2014|df=mdy-all}} followed by ''Near Dusk'' (2015), ''Beachscape'' (2016),{{cite web|url=http://www.instyle.com/news/jennifer-aniston-fragrance-beachscape-interview|title=Jennifer Aniston's New Scent is the Beach Vacation You've Always Wanted|website=Instyle.com|accessdate=2017-03-03}} ''Luxe'' and ''Chapter One'' (both in 2017).{{cite web|url=https://www.fragrantica.com/news/Jennifer-Aniston-Luxe-9821.html|title=Jennifer Aniston Luxe|publisher=Fragrantica.com|date=August 28, 2017|accessdate=November 5, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/Jennifer-Aniston/Chapter-One-47060.html|title=Chapter One Jennifer Aniston perfume – a new fragrance for women 2017|website=www.fragrantica.com}} Since 2007, she has worked in a publicity campaign for the drink [[Energy Brands|SmartWater]]; on March 7, 2011, she released a YouTube video, titled "[[Jennifer Aniston Goes Viral]]", for SmartWater, which tripled online interest in the product within 24 hours of its release.{{cite web |url=http://omg.yahoo.com/blogs/whoknew/jennifer-aniston-viral-video-sets-web-abuzz/49?nc |title=Jennifer Aniston Viral Video Sets Web Abuzz |publisher=Yahoo News |date=March 8, 2011 |accessdate=March 10, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110313080616/http://omg.yahoo.com/blogs/whoknew/jennifer-aniston-viral-video-sets-web-abuzz/49?nc |archivedate=March 13, 2011 |df=mdy-all }}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rc47LcvIxyI |title= jennifer aniston goes viral – smartwater |publisher=YouTube |date=March 7, 2011 |format=Flash Video|accessdate=March 10, 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/healthylifestyle/news/sweaty-jen-aniston-bares-her-six-pack-in-sexy-new-ad-1970241 |title=Jen Aniston Rolls Around in Bed Topless, Flashes Abs in Sexy New Ads |work=Us Weekly |date=May 18, 2010 |accessdate=June 23, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100621050715/http://www.usmagazine.com/healthylifestyle/news/sweaty-jen-aniston-bares-her-six-pack-in-sexy-new-ad-1970241 |archivedate=June 21, 2010 }} In 2012, Aniston co-founded a hair care brand Living Proof and also became its spokesperson. The company was sold in 2016 to [[Unilever]] and Aniston left at that time.{{cite web|url=http://www.livingproof.com/jen/announce |title=Jennifer Aniston is Living Proof |publisher=livingproof.com |accessdate=February 14, 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150215021736/http://www.livingproof.com/jen/announce |archivedate=February 15, 2015 }}{{cite web|last=Saltzman |first=Stephanie |url=http://fashionista.com/2016/12/unilever-living-proof-jennifer-aniston |title=Jennifer Aniston Splits With Living Proof as Unilver Acquires The Brand |website=Fashionista.com |date=2016-12-16 |accessdate=2017-03-03}}{{cite web|author=Omar Oakes |url=http://www.campaignlive.co.uk/article/unilever-buy-haircare-brand-part-owned-jennifer-aniston/1419084 |title=Unilever to buy haircare brand part-owned by Jennifer Aniston |website=Campaignlive.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2017-03-03}} In January 2013, she became the new spokesperson and face of [[Aveeno|Aveeno Skincare]].{{cite news|title=Jennifer Aniston Named the New Face of Aveeno Skincare|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-beauty/news/jennifer-aniston-named-the-new-face-of-aveeno-skincare-2013181|accessdate=June 20, 2013|newspaper=US Magazine|date=January 18, 2013}} The commercials began airing in May 2013.{{cite web|title=Naturally Beautiful Results with Jennifer Aniston|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B_ofl5OivI0|publisher=YouTube|accessdate=June 20, 2013}} In 2015, she became the new face of [[Emirates (airline)|Emirates airline]] in a deal reported to be roughly {{USD}}5 million.{{cite news|title=Jennifer Aniston lands $5M deal with Emirates Airline|url=http://pagesix.com/2015/08/07/jennifer-aniston-lands-5m-deal-with-emirates-airline/|accessdate=October 24, 2015|publisher=New York Post|date=August 7, 2015}}{{cite news|title=Jennifer Aniston: The new face of Emirates airline?|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/travel/flights/todayinthesky/2015/08/10/jennifer-aniston--new-face--emirates-airline/31400629/|accessdate=August 13, 2015|publisher=USA Today|date=August 10, 2015}} Aniston's marketing campaign for the Dubai-based Emirates airline was reportedly a success, with the airline bagging No.1 position as the most popular brand in the UAE for the second consecutive year.{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.in/jennifer-aniston-helps-emirates-fly-high-airline-ranked-uaes-top-brand-687048|title=Jennifer Aniston helps Emirates fly high; airline ranked UAE's top brand|first=Kalyani|last=Pandey|website=Ibtimes.co.in|accessdate=2017-03-03}} The second ad was released in October 2016.{{cite web|url=http://www.thenational.ae/business/aviation/jens-back-emirates-releases-new-advert-with-actress-for-its-a380-service |title=Jen's back! Emirates releases new advert with actress for its A380 service |publisher=The National|date=October 5, 2016|accessdate=2016-12-09}} In 2016, Aniston became a spokesperson for the Eyelove campaign to raise awareness of [[Dry eye syndrome|chronic dry eye]].{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/shire-and-jennifer-aniston-want-to-inspire-people-to-show-their-eyes-some-love-and-help-raise-awareness-of-chronic-dry-eye-591263151.html|title=Shire and Jennifer Aniston Want to Inspire People to Show Their Eyes Some Love and Help Raise Awareness of Chronic Dry Eye|website=Prnewswire.com|accessdate=2017-03-03}}{{cite web|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/boston/blog/bioflash/2016/08/jennifer-aniston-to-help-shire-launch-its-first.html|title=Jennifer Aniston to help Shire launch its first treatment for eye disease |publisher=Boston Business Journal}} ==Philanthropy== Aniston is a supporter of Friends of El Faro, a [[grassroots]] non-profit organization that helps raise money for Casa Hogar Sion, an orphanage in [[Tijuana]], Mexico. She has appeared in many TV commercials for [[St. Jude's Children's Research Hospital]], which she supports. She also hosted September 2008's [[Stand Up to Cancer]] show.{{cite web|url=http://www.looktothestars.org/news/4438-stand-up-to-cancer-to-return-with-second-celebrity-charity-telecast|title='Stand Up To Cancer' to return with second celebrity charity telecast|publisher=Looktothestars.org|date=May 20, 2010|accessdate=June 23, 2010}} In the "It Can't Wait" campaign to free [[Burma]], Aniston directed and starred in a video.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wOHV0C__jZI|title=Jennifer Aniston & Woody Harrelson Burma: It Can't Wait Day 29|publisher=YouTube|format=Flash Video|accessdate=June 23, 2010}} On April 14, 2007, Aniston received [[GLAAD|GLAAD's]] Vanguard Award for her contributions to increased visibility and understanding of the lesbian, gay, [[bisexual]] and [[transgender]] (LGBT) community.{{cite web|url=http://uk.eonline.com/uberblog/b59125_Exclusive_Aniston_Gets_Some_Gay_Lovin.html|title=Exclusive! Aniston Gets Some Gay Lovin'|publisher=Uk.eonline.com|date=April 2, 2007|accessdate=June 23, 2010}} On [[Earth Day]] 2010, she joined [[Courteney Cox]], [[Woody Harrelson]], [[Ben Stiller]] and others, in "The Cove PSA: My Friend is...",{{cite web|url=http://mygloss.com/buzz/2010/04/22/earth-day-psa-celebrities-the-cove |title=Earth Day PSA from 'The Cove' Team Gets Celebrity Support: Jennifer Aniston and friends in The Cove PSA directed by Andrés Useche |publisher=Mygloss.com |date=April 22, 2010 |accessdate=June 23, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100625060446/http://mygloss.com/buzz/2010/04/22/earth-day-psa-celebrities-the-cove/ |archivedate=June 25, 2010 }} an effort to stop the slaughter of dolphins and protect the Japanese people from the toxic levels of [[Mercury (element)|mercury]] found in dolphin meat. Other charities that Aniston has supported include AmeriCares, Clothes Off Our Back, Feeding America, EB Medical Research Foundation, Project A.L.S., [[OmniPeace]], and [[Rape, Abuse & Incest National Network]].{{cite web|url=http://www.looktothestars.org/celebrity/92-jennifer-aniston|title=Jennifer Aniston's Charity Work, Events and Causes|publisher=Looktothestars.org|accessdate=June 23, 2010}} Aniston donated {{USD}}500,000 to [[Doctors Without Borders]], Haitian health care provider [[Partners In Health]] and [[AmeriCares]],{{cite news|title=Aniston donates $500k to Haiti appeal|publisher=Ireland Online|date=January 26, 2010|url=http://breakingnews.iol.ie/entertainment/aniston-donates-500k-to-haiti-appeal-443553.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100130144736/http://breakingnews.iol.ie/entertainment/aniston-donates-500k-to-haiti-appeal-443553.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=January 30, 2010|accessdate=January 26, 2010}}{{cite web|last=Donaldson|first=Catherine|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20339320,00.html|title=Report: Jennifer Aniston Gives $500,000 to Haiti|work=People|date=January 25, 2010|accessdate=June 23, 2010}} and also participated in the [[Hope for Haiti Now]] [[telethon]].{{cite web|last=Coulton|first=Antoinette Y.|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20338952,00.html|title=Brad Pitt and Jen Aniston Participate in Haiti Telethon|work=People|date=January 22, 2010|accessdate=June 23, 2010}}{{cite web|author=Jennifer Aniston|url=http://uk.eonline.com/uberblog/marc_malkin/b163862_jennifer_aniston_makes_major_haiti.html|title=Jennifer Aniston Makes Major Haiti Donation|publisher=E! Online|work=uk.eonline.com|date=January 25, 2010|accessdate=June 23, 2010}} In 2013, she was named the [[Entertainment Industry Foundation]] (EIF) ambassador for the [[Saks Fifth Avenue]] Key To The Cure campaign, which raises funds for the EIF Women's Cancer Research Fund to support research into the detection, treatment, and cures for women's cancers.{{cite news|title=Jennifer Aniston Named EIF Ambassador to Saks Fifth Avenue's Key to the Cure Campaign Read more about Jennifer Aniston Named EIF Ambassador to Saks Fifth Avenue's Key to the Cure Campaign - BWWFashionWorld by fashion.broadwayworld.com|url=http://fashion.broadwayworld.com/article/Jennifer-Aniston-Named-EIF-Ambassador-to-Saks-Fifth-Avenues-Key-to-the-Cure-Campaign-20130624|date=June 24, 2013|accessdate=July 8, 2013}} In 2015, she supported the [[Comic Relief, Inc.]] charity.{{cite tweet|user=RedNoseDayUSA|author=Red Nose Day USA|number=601540801642909696|date=22 May 2015|title=It's true: all celebrities are best friends. Join them to see how #RedNose Day all came together!}} In 2016, Aniston was honored by [[Brands|SmartWater]] for her ongoing philanthropic work for [[St. Jude's Children's Research Hospital]] at a special event in LA for the hospital that was attended by numerous celebrities. During the event, Aniston spoke of the importance of philanthropy in her life to ''[[InStyle]]'' magazine stating, "We live an extremely beautiful, fortunate life being able to do what we get to do for a living. And so it's a way of being able to be in a position to do something for people who are less able. It's something that makes my heart smile."{{cite news|title=Jennifer Aniston Is Honored for Her Philanthropic Work with St. Jude Children's Research Hospital|url=http://www.instyle.com/news/jennifer-aniston-smartwater-sparkling-st-jude-childrens-hospital-party|accessdate=6 May 2016|publisher=InStyle.com|date=24 February 2016}} On October 12, 2017, it was reported that Aniston had donated US$500,000 to the [[Red Cross]] and another US$500,000 to the Ricky Martin Foundation to help victims of [[Hurricane Harvey]], [[Hurricane Irma|Irma]] and [[Hurricane Maria|Maria]].{{cite web|url=http://www.etonline.com/jennifer-aniston-donates-1-million-red-cross-and-ricky-martin-foundation-hurricane-relief-89147?linkId=43443150|title=Jennifer Aniston Donates $1 Million to Red Cross and Ricky Martin Foundation for Hurricane Relief|publisher=}} ==Personal life== ===Relationships=== Aniston met [[Brad Pitt]] in 1998; their relationship became high-profile as it was widely publicized in the press.{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/jennifer_aniston/biography|title=Jennifer Aniston Biography|accessdate=2008-05-21|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]}}{{cite web|url=https://movies.yahoo.com/movie/contributor/1800021397/bio|title=Jennifer Aniston Biography|accessdate=May 21, 2008|publisher=[[Yahoo!]]}} She married Pitt, after two years of dating, on July 29, 2000 in a lavish [[Malibu, California|Malibu]] wedding.{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/brad_pitt/biography/0,,20004328_10,00.html|title=Brad Pitt Biography|accessdate=May 21, 2008|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]}} For a few years, their marriage was considered the rare Hollywood success. On January 7, 2005, they announced their separation{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,26334,1015778,00.html|title=Jennifer Aniston and Brad Pitt Separate|accessdate=2008-08-08|date=2005-01-07|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080709064454/http://www.people.com/people/article/0,26334,1015778,00.html|archivedate=July 9, 2008|df=mdy-all}} and finalized their divorce on October 2, 2005.{{cite web |first=Serena |last=Kappes |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,1112350,00.html |title=Brad & Jen Finalize Divorce|accessdate=May 21, 2008|date=September 30, 2005|work=[[People (American magazine)|People]]}} During their divorce proceedings, there was intense speculation in the media that Pitt had been unfaithful to Aniston with his ''[[Mr. & Mrs. Smith (2005 film)|Mr. & Mrs. Smith]]'' co-star [[Angelina Jolie]], whom he started dating soon after the split.{{cite news|url=https://movies.nytimes.com/person/1831/Jennifer-Aniston/biography |title=Jennifer Aniston – Biography – Movies & TV |work=The New York Times|accessdate=June 23, 2010}} In the following months, the public's reaction toward the divorce was reported in the press, and "Team Aniston" and "Team Jolie" T-shirts appeared throughout the country. The divorce made the front-pages of tabloid magazines for years, and it still continues to be discussed in the media. Aniston commented on the divorce in a January 2015 interview with ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'', stating that "Nobody did anything wrong.... It was just like, sometimes things [happen]."{{cite news|first=Stephen|last=Galloway|title=Jennifer Aniston Reveals Struggles With Dyslexia, Anger; Shrugs Off Oscar Snub|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/jennifer-aniston-reveals-struggles-dyslexia-764854|accessdate= May 21, 2015|work=The Hollywood Reporter|date=January 21, 2015}} In 2005, amid reports that Pitt and Aniston's divorce was due to Aniston's refusal to have children with Pitt, Aniston stated to ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'', "I've never in my life said I didn't want to have children. I did and I do and I will... I would never give up that experience for a career." Aniston also revealed that her divorce prompted her to reach out to her mother, Nancy, from whom she was estranged for nearly a decade. They initially became estranged when Nancy talked about her daughter on a television show and later wrote a book entitled, ''From Mother and Daughter to Friends: A Memoir'' (1999).{{cite web|url=http://www.vanityfair.com/fame/features/2005/09/aniston200509 |title=The Unsinkable Jennifer Aniston |accessdate=August 8, 2008 |date=September 2005 |work=[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080914093424/http://www.vanityfair.com/fame/features/2005/09/aniston200509 |archivedate=September 14, 2008 }}{{cite news | first=Charles | last=Laurence |title=Not even friends... | date=December 15, 2006 | publisher=''Los Angeles National Post'' | url =http://www.fact.on.ca/news/news0001/np00010b.htm}} Aniston has also stated she was devastated by the death of her longtime therapist, whose work helped make her separation from Pitt easier. Aniston said her relationship with Pitt, which she does not regret, was "seven very intense years together" and that "it was a beautiful, complicated relationship".{{cite web|work=Daily Times|title=Aniston just wants to make Friends with Pitt|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2006\06\19\story_19-6-2006_pg9_1|accessdate=June 18, 2006}} Aniston started a relationship with actor, director, and screenwriter [[Justin Theroux]] in May 2011. In January 2012, Aniston and Theroux purchased a home in Los Angeles's [[Bel Air, Los Angeles|Bel-Air]] neighborhood for roughly {{USD}}22 million.{{cite news |url=https://blogs.wsj.com/developments/2012/01/24/aniston-and-theroux-to-buy-in-bel-air/ |title=Aniston and Theroux to Buy in Bel-Air|accessdate=January 24, 2012 | location=New York|work=The Wall Street Journal|first=Lauren|last=Schuker|date=January 24, 2012}} They became engaged on August 10, 2012{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20620514,00.html|title=Jennifer Aniston Is Engaged to Justin Theroux!|last=Jordan|first=Julie|date=August 12, 2012|work=[[People (American magazine)|People]]|publisher=[[Time Inc.]]|accessdate=August 12, 2012}} and were married on August 5, 2015 at their Bel-Air estate.{{cite news|first=Emily|last=Zauzmer|title=Jennifer Aniston And Justin Theroux Are Married!|url=http://www.people.com/article/jennifer-aniston-justin-theroux-married-wedding-bel-air-home|accessdate= May 21, 2015|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=August 6, 2015}} On February 15, 2018, Aniston and Theroux announced in a statement to the [[Associated Press]] their decision to separate at the end of 2017.{{cite news | url=https://apnews.com/29ef88e81f554ac8a38a763454350cf3|title=Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux announce seperation| first= Sandy|last= Kohen| agency=Associated Press (AP)| date=February 15, 2018| accessdate=March 2, 2018 | location=Los Angeles, California, United States | quote=Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux are separating after two and a half years of marriage. [...] Aniston and Theroux were engaged in August of 2012 and married in August of 2015.}} ===Politics=== Aniston is a Democrat, donating to [[Barack Obama]]'s presidential campaign and taking part in a fund-raising lunch for [[Hillary Clinton]] during her 2016 Presidential campaign.{{Cite news|url=https://people.com/celebrity/aniston-clooney-throw-money-into-presidential-race/|title=Aniston, Clooney Throw Money into Presidential Race|work=PEOPLE.com|access-date=2018-05-29|language=en}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/envelope/gossip/la-et-mg-hillary-clinton-fundraiser-timberlake-biel-dicaprio-20160824-snap-htmlstory.html|title=Justin Timberlake, Jessica Biel, Jennifer Aniston and more do lunch with Hillary Clinton|last=D'Zurilla|first=Christie|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-05-29}}{{Cite web|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/04/16/celebrity.contributions/index.html|title=Celebrities ante up for Democratic campaigns - CNN.com|last=Bureau|first=By Robert Yoon CNN Washington|website=edition.cnn.com|language=en|access-date=2018-05-29}} ===Health and fitness=== Aniston practices [[Hatha yoga|yoga]] and [[Budokan karate]].{{cite news|first=Samantha|last=Schnurr|title=Jennifer Aniston Dedicates Every Morning to Exercise|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/751703/jennifer-aniston-dedicates-every-morning-to-exercise|accessdate=8 May 2016|publisher=E Online|date=25 March 2016}}{{cite web|last=Shah |first=Deepa |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/lifestyle/wellbeing/diet/3324612/Meditation-that-comes-with-a-kick.html |title=Meditation that comes with a kick |publisher=Telegraph |date=2005-10-10 |accessdate=2016-02-07}}{{cite web|last=Gregoire|first=Carolyn|title=10 Celebrities Leading The Wellness Revolution|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/03/13/celebrity-health-10-stars_n_2861423.html#slide=2210511|accessdate=29 April 2014|quote=Jennifer Aniston is a long-time yoga practitioner – she's appeared in a ''Yogalosophy'' DVD and even given Oprah a yoga mat – and she's one of the most famous devotees of TM. The 43-year-old actress has said of her yoga routine, 'If I don't do it then my spirit sort of goes.'}} In 2014, Aniston spoke of her [[Transcendental Meditation technique|Transcendental Meditation]] practice.{{cite web|title=Jennifer Aniston: Transcendental meditation keeps me looking good|url=http://www.contactmusic.com/story/jennifer-aniston-transcendental-meditation-keeps-me-looking-good_4127769|accessdate=29 April 2014|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6PCWoqRUn?url=http://www.contactmusic.com/story/jennifer-aniston-transcendental-meditation-keeps-me-looking-good_4127769|archivedate=2014-04-29}} Aniston said she had undiagnosed [[dyslexia]], which had affected her education and self-esteem, and that after being diagnosed in her 20s, her outlook toward life changed. She stated, "I thought I wasn't smart. I just couldn't retain anything. Now I had this great discovery. I felt like all of my childhood trauma-dies, tragedies, dramas were explained." ==In the media== ===Wealth=== Aniston is one of the highest-paid actresses in Hollywood.{{cite web|title=Hollywood's Highest Paid Actresses|url=https://www.forbes.com/pictures/mfl45gdgh/jennifer-aniston-28-million/|publisher=Forbes|accessdate=December 24, 2014}}{{cite news|title=Sandra Bullock's $51 million tops Forbes list of highest paid actresses|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/movies/sandra-bullock-tops-forbes-list-highest-paid-actresses-article-1.1891501|accessdate=December 24, 2014|publisher=nydailynews.com|date=August 4, 2014}} In 2007, ''[[Forbes]]'' rated her as one of the top 20 richest women in entertainment and estimated her net worth to be about {{USD}}110 million.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/2007/01/17/richest-women-entertainment-tech-media-cz_lg_richwomen07_0118womenstars_slide_11.html |title=The Richest 20 Women In Entertainment |publisher=Forbes.com |date=January 17, 2007 |accessdate=December 11, 2011 |first1=Lea |last1=Goldman |first2=Kiri |last2=Blakeley}} Aniston was also included in the annual Star Salary Top 10 of trade magazine ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' for 2006.{{cite web | title=Nicole Kidman Tops Hollywood Earners List at Hollywood.com | url=http://www.hollywood.com/news/Kidman_Tops_Hollywood_Earners_List/3591650| accessdate=March 2, 2007 }} According to ''Forbes'', in October 2007, Aniston was the top-selling celebrity face of the entertainment industry.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/home/media/2007/10/02/celebrity-magazines-publishing-biz-media_cx_lr_1002coverstars.html|title=Fab Tab Cover Stars|accessdate=August 8, 2008|date=October 2, 2007|work=[[Forbes]]}} She was also Hollywood's most profitable actress. Aniston has been on the ''Forbes'' Celebrity 100 list, based on "earnings and fame", every year since 2001, topping the list in 2003.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/static_html/celebs/2003/index.shtml | work=Forbes | title=The Celebrity 100 | date=June 19, 2003}} For the year of 2008, ''Forbes'' listed Aniston's earnings as {{USD}}27 million.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/home/2008/06/11/most-powerful-celebrities-lists-celebrities08-cx_mn_0611c_land.html|title=The Celebrity 100|work=Forbes |date=June 12, 2008}} In 2014, Aniston ranked 3rd on ''Forbes'' Top Earning Actresses, earning US$31 million in that year.{{cite web|title=Top Earnings Actresses 2014|url=https://www.forbes.com/pictures/mfl45ekhif/jennifer-aniston-12/|publisher=Forbes|accessdate=February 23, 2015}} Her net worth is estimated to be {{USD}}150 million {{as of|2014|lc=y}}.{{cite news|last1=Tucker|first1=Reed|title=10 years later, how do the 'Friends' stack up?|url=https://nypost.com/2014/05/04/10-years-later-how-do-the-friends-stack-up/|accessdate=August 22, 2015|publisher=[[New York Post]]|date=May 4, 2014}} In 2015, Aniston ranked 5th on ''Forbes'' Top Earning Actresses, earning US$16.5 million in that year.{{cite web|title=Top Earnings Actresses 2015|url=https://www.forbes.com/pictures/emjl45eddhj/5-jennifer-aniston/|publisher=Forbes|accessdate=August 23, 2015}} In 2016, Aniston ranked 4th on ''Forbes'' Top Earning Actresses, earning US$21 million in that year. She has been on the ''Forbes'' Top Earning Actresses for 15 years, every year since 2001.{{cite web|title=Top Earnings Actresses 2015|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/natalierobehmed/2016/08/23/the-worlds-highest-paid-actresses-2016-jennifer-lawrence-banks-46-million-payday-ahead-of-melissa-mccarthy/|publisher=Forbes|accessdate=August 23, 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/hayleycuccinello/2016/08/29/top-earning-actresses-a-decade-ago-jennifer-aniston-and-julia-roberts-still-reign-supreme/|title=Top-Earning Actresses A Decade Ago: Jennifer Aniston And Julia Roberts Still Reign Supreme|first=Hayley C.|last=Cuccinello|website=Forbes.com|accessdate=2017-03-03}} In May 2017, ''Forbes'' estimated Aniston's net worth to be US$200 million.{{cite web|last1=Tindera|first1=Michela|title=From A 'Friends' Star To A Microneedling Founder: Four Women Entrepreneurs To Watch In 2017|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/michelatindera/2017/05/18/from-a-friends-star-to-a-microneedling-founder-four-women-entrepreneurs-to-watch-in-2017/|website=Forbes|publisher=Forbes|accessdate=14 June 2017}} The following August, the magazine ranked her as the world's second highest-paid actress with yearly earnings of $25.5 million.{{cite news|last1=Robehmed|first1=Natalie|title=The World's Highest-Paid Actresses 2017: Emma Stone Leads With $26 Million|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/natalierobehmed/2017/08/16/the-worlds-highest-paid-actresses-2017-emma-stone-leads-with-26-million/|accessdate=August 17, 2017|work=Forbes|date=August 16, 2017}} ===Public image=== [[File:Jennifer Aniston estrella.jpg|thumb|200px|left|Aniston's star on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]]]] Aniston has been included in magazines' lists of the world's most beautiful women.{{cite web|title=Beautiful 'People'|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/pictures/beautiful-people/5/|publisher=cbs news|accessdate=December 3, 2014}}{{cite web|title=Why They Still Look This Fantastic|url=http://www.cosmopolitan.com/style-beauty/beauty/advice/a2979/celebrity-skin-anti-aging-0909/|publisher=cosmopolitan magazine|date=September 15, 2009|accessdate=December 3, 2014|author=Amelia Gayle}}{{cite web|title=Women we love|url=http://www.esquire.com/women/women-we-love/|publisher=Esquire magazine|accessdate=December 3, 2014}} In 2005, she became the first-ever ''[[GQ]]'' Woman of the Year. She has frequently appeared on ''[[People (American magazine)|People]]''{{'}}s annual list of "[[People (magazine)#People Magazine's 100 Most Beautiful People|Most Beautiful Women]]", and was number-one in 2004 and recently in 2016.{{cite news|author=Julie Jordan|title=Jennifer Aniston Is PEOPLE's 2016 World's Most Beautiful Woman!|accessdate=3 May 2016|publisher=people|date=20 April 2016|url=http://www.people.com/people/package/article/0,,20998070_21001278,00.html}} She also topped the magazine's Best Dressed List in 2006. She has been a regular on ''[[FHM]]''{{'}}s [[FHM's 100 Sexiest Women (UK)|100 Sexiest Women]] list since 1996, ranking at number 79 in 2012, number 81 in 2010, number 24 in 2009, and number 27 in 2008.{{cite web|url=http://www.fhm.com/girls/covergirls/jennifer-aniston |title=Jennifer Aniston at |publisher=Fhm.com |accessdate=December 11, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111130163158/http://www.fhm.com/girls/covergirls/jennifer-aniston |archivedate=November 30, 2011 }} In 2011, ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'' reported the most sought after body parts of the rich and famous revealed by two Hollywood [[plastic surgeons]] who carried out a [[Statistical survey|survey]] among their patients to build up the picture of what the perfect woman would look like. Under the category of the most sought after body shape, Aniston was voted in the top three, alongside [[Gisele Bündchen]] and [[Penélope Cruz]].{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/celebritynews/8284381/Hollywoods-most-sought-after-body-parts.html |title=Hollywood's most sought after body parts|work=The Telegraph|date=January 27, 2011 |accessdate=February 1, 2011|location=London}} In the same year, readers of ''[[Men's Health (magazine)|Men's Health]]'' magazine voted Aniston the "Sexiest Woman of All Time".{{cite news |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-31749_162-57341356-10391698/jennifer-aniston-named-hottest-woman-of-all-time-by-mens-health/ |title=Jennifer Aniston named hottest woman of all time by Men's Health |first=Lauren| last=Moraski|date=December 12, 2011 |accessdate=July 9, 2013 |publisher=CBS News}} Although Aniston disliked the hairstyle she wore during her first two years on ''Friends'', "[[Rachel haircut|The Rachel]]" became very popular among women.{{cite news|last=Oldenburg|first=Ann|title=Jennifer Aniston tells 'Allure' she hated her Rachel hair |url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/entertainment/post/2011/01/jennifer-aniston-tells-allure-she-hated-her-rachel-hair--/1|accessdate=January 19, 2011|newspaper=USA Today|date=January 18, 2011}}{{cite news |first=Elisa |last=Roche |newspaper=Daily Express |title=JENNIFER ANISTON'S A CUT ABOVE FOR 11 MILLION WOMEN |url=http://www.express.co.uk/posts/view/177204/Jennifer-Aniston-s-a-cut-above-for-11-million-women |date=May 26, 2010 |accessdate=January 19, 2011}} Aniston received a [[List of actors with Hollywood Walk of Fame motion picture stars|motion pictures star]] on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]] on February 22, 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.walkoffame.com/jennifer-aniston |title=Hollywood Walk of Fame – Jennifer Aniston |website=walkoffame.com |publisher=Hollywood Chamber of Commerce |access-date=November 8, 2017}} The star is located at 6270 [[Hollywood Boulevard]].{{cite news|last=Heller|first=Corinne|title=Jennifer Aniston gets star on Hollywood Walk of Fame, thanks 'Papa' (Video)|url=http://www.ontheredcarpet.com/Jennifer-Aniston-gets-star-on-Hollywood-Walk-of-Fame--thanks-Papa-Video/8553842|accessdate=May 17, 2013|newspaper=ontheredcarpet.com|date=February 22, 2012}} Her star is the 2,462nd placed on the Walk of Fame.{{cite news|last=Moraski|first=Lauren|title=Jennifer Aniston gets a star on Walk of Fame|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-31749_162-57383505-10391698/jennifer-aniston-gets-a-star-on-walk-of-fame/|accessdate=May 17, 2013|newspaper=CBS News|date=February 23, 2012}} On ''[[Forbes]]''{{'}} list of the 100 Most Powerful Actresses in Hollywood, she was ranked eighth in 2009,{{cite news|title=Most Powerful Actresses|url=https://www.forbes.com/2009/06/03/forbes-100-celebrity-09-actresses_slide_3.html|newspaper=Forbes|date=June 3, 2009|accessdate=July 1, 2013}} second in both 2011 and 2012,{{cite news|title=The 10 Most Powerful Actresses|url=https://www.forbes.com/pictures/eidm45jd/jennifer-aniston/|newspaper=Forbes|date=May 16, 2011|accessdate=July 1, 2013}}{{cite news|title=Celebrity Actresses 2012|url=https://www.forbes.com/pictures/mfl45jjhm/jennifer-aniston-2/|newspaper=Forbes|date=May 16, 2012|accessdate=July 1, 2013}} and third in 2013.{{cite news|title=Celeb 100: Power Actresses|url=https://www.forbes.com/pictures/mfl45efhjh/jennifer-aniston-4/|date=June 26, 2013|accessdate=July 1, 2013|newspaper=Forbes}} In July 2016, Jennifer Aniston wrote an essay for ''[[The Huffington Post]]'', in reply to recent rumors about her, where she criticized "The objectification and scrutiny we put women through..." and stated that "We are complete with or without a mate, with or without a child. We get to decide for ourselves what is beautiful when it comes to our bodies....We don't need to be married or mothers to be complete. We get to determine our own "happily ever after" for ourselves."{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/for-the-record_us_57855586e4b03fc3ee4e626f|title=Jennifer Aniston: 'For The Record, I Am Not Pregnant. What I Am Is Fed Up'|date=July 12, 2016|website=Huffingtonpost.com|accessdate=2017-03-03}} The essay was supported by many celebrities and thoroughly discussed in the media.{{Cite news|url=http://etcanada.com/news/152041/celebrities-praise-jennifer-anistons-powerful-essay-slamming-medias-objectification-of-female-stars/|title=Celebrities Praise Jennifer Aniston's Anti-Objectification Essay|last=Ogweng|first=Sylvia|date=2016-07-13|newspaper=ET Canada|access-date=2017-01-30}} ===Cultural impact=== Aniston has been mentioned in film and TV, including ''[[Scream 2]]'', ''[[Arrested Development (TV series)|Arrested Development]]'',{{Citation|last=Dominik Sendorek|title="If I'm no Schwimmer, you're no Jennifer Aniston!"|date=2010-07-08|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sUo5af3Wy6U|accessdate=2018-05-29}} ''[[Monk (TV series)|Monk]]'',{{Citation|title="Monk" Mr. Monk and the Foreign Man (TV Episode 2009)|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1480119/movieconnections|accessdate=2018-05-29}} ''[[The Simpsons]]'', ''[[Fresh Off the Boat]]'' and ''[[Master of None]]''.{{Citation|last=Jimmy Kimmel Live|title=Lena Waithe Has a Major Crush on Jennifer Aniston|date=2018-03-14|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZiAHRCCGWkg|accessdate=2018-05-29}} She has been called a role model by [[Kaley Cuoco]],{{Citation|last=Late Night with Seth Meyers|title=Kaley Cuoco's Dream Fan Encounter with Jennifer Aniston|date=2016-05-11|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bYZHTwRXqes&t=106s|accessdate=2018-05-29}} [[Selena Gomez]],{{Citation|last=radiodisney|title=Selena Gomez - Meeting Jennifer Aniston & Performing at the RDMAs! {{!}} Radio Disney|date=2013-04-18|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3tl34eAk7sI|accessdate=2018-05-29}} and [[Miley Cyrus]].{{cite news|first=Eric|last=Ditzian|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1608304/miley-cyrus-counts-jennifer-aniston-and-angelina-jolie-as-role-models/|title=Miley Cyrus Counts Jennifer Aniston and Angelina Jolie as Role Models|publisher=[[mtv.com]]|date=April 1, 2009|accessdate=February 16, 2018}} ==Works and accolades== {{Main|List of Jennifer Aniston performances|List of awards and nominations received by Jennifer Aniston|l2=awards and nominations}} Aniston came to prominence in 1994 with her role of Rachel Green in the widely popular television sitcom ''Friends''. She has since appeared in numerous critically acclaimed and commercially successful films. According to the review aggregator site [[Rotten Tomatoes]] and the box-office site [[Box Office Mojo]], those are ''Office Space'' (1999), ''[[The Iron Giant]]'' (1999), ''The Good Girl'' (2002), ''Bruce Almighty'' (2003), ''The Break-Up'' (2006), ''Friends with Money'' (2006), ''Marley & Me'' (2008), ''Just Go with It'' (2011), ''Horrible Bosses'' (2011) and ''We're the Millers'' (2013).{{cite web|title=Jennifer Aniston|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/celebrity/jennifer_aniston|publisher=Rotten Tomatoes|accessdate=November 5, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.boxofficemojo.com/people/chart/?view=Actor&id=jenniferaniston.htm&sort=rank&order=ASC&p=.htm|title=Jennifer Aniston Movie Box Office Results|accessdate=July 30, 2010|publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]]}} The actress has received five Primetime Emmy nominations for ''Friends'', including one win, and one nomination for her guest appearance in ''30 Rock''. She has also been nominated for two Golden Globes and nine Screen Actors Guild Awards (SAG) for her role on the former, winning one of each. Her performance in ''Cake'' (2014) also earned her Golden Globe and SAG Award nominations. ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==Further reading== * {{cite book|last=Smith|first=Sean|title=Jennifer: The Unauthorized Biography|year=2008|publisher=Macmillan UK|isbn=978-0330449977}} * {{cite book|last=Marshall|first=Sarah|title=Jennifer Aniston: The Biography of Hollywood's Sweetheart|year=2007|publisher=[[John Blake (journalist)|John Blake]]|isbn=978-1844544004}} * {{cite book|last=Lynette|first=Rachel|title=Jennifer Aniston|year=2010|publisher=Lucent Books|isbn= 978-1420502350}} * {{cite book|last= Bonner|first=Mike|title=Jennifer Aniston|year=2001|publisher=Chelsea House Publications|isbn= 978-0791064658}} ==External links== {{Infobox journal | title = Journal of Education for Sustainable Development | cover = | editor = Prithi Nambiar | discipline = [[Education]] & [[Development Studies]] | former_names = | abbreviation = J. Educ. Sustain. Dev. | publisher = [[Sage Publications]] | country = | frequency = Bi-annually | history = Mar 2007 | openaccess = | license = | impact = | impact-year = | website = http://jsd.sagepub.com/ | link1 = http://jsd.sagepub.com/content/current | link1-name = Online access | link2 = http://jsd.sagepub.com/content/by/year | link2-name = Online archive | JSTOR = | OCLC = | LCCN = | CODEN = | ISSN = 0973-4082 | eISSN = 0973-4074 }} The '''''Journal of Education for Sustainable Development''''' is a forum for discussion and dialogues in the emerging field of Education for Sustainable Development (ESD). The Journal is published by [http://www.sagepub.in/home.nav SAGE Publications, India] in association with the [http://www.ceeindia.org/cee/index.html Centre for Environment Education].
The journal is a member of the Committee on Publication Ethics (COPE).
== Abstracting and indexing == ''Journal of Education for Sustainable Development'' is abstracted and indexed in: * ProQuest: International Bibliography of the Social Sciences (IBSS) * ProQuest Science Journals * DeepDyve * [[Portico]] * Dutch-KB * [[EBSCO]] * [[OCLC]] * [[Indian Citation Index|ICI]] * Sustainable Development * Illustrata: Natural Science * Illustrata: Technology Collection * ProQuest Engineering * ProQuest Green Technology * ProQuest Environmental Sciences * ProQuest Sustainability Science * Illustrata: Technology * ProQuest Education * ProQuest Earth Sciences * J-Gate

revision.comment: [[c:Help:Cat-a-lot|Cat-a-lot]]: Copying from [[Category:21st-century New Zealand women writers]] to [[Category:21st-century New Zealand writers]]
revision.text:
{{Notability|Biographies|date=November 2010}} '''Joy Dawson''' is a New Zealand [[missionary]] and [[intercession|intercessor]] who has been teaching the [[Bible]] internationally since 1970. Her missionary work has taken her to over 55 nations. She has taught extensively on [[television]] and [[radio]], and her books, audio and video tapes have been translated and distributed worldwide. She currently resides in [[Tujunga, California]].
Joy and her husband Jim are unsalaried missionaries with Youth With A Mission, an interdenominational missionary organization operating in 173 countries, and are elders of The Church On The Way, in Van Nuys, California.
Three generations of Joy and Jim's family are in full-time ministry on three different continents, and in four countries.
== Bibliography == *''Intimate Friendship With God'' (1986) *''How to Pray for Someone Near You Who is Away from God'' (1990) *''Some of the Ways of God in Healing'' (1991) *''Intercession: Thrilling, Fulfilling'' (1997) *''Forever Ruined For The Ordinary - The Adventure Of Hearing And Obeying The Voice Of God'' (2001) *''Knowing God'' (2001) *''Influencing Children to Become World Changers'' (2003) *''Un Ministerio Emocionante y Pleno'' (2004) *''The Fire of God: Discovering Its Many Life Changing Purposes'' (2005) *''All Heaven Will Break Loose: When We Make Jesus’ Priorities Our Passion'' (2014)
==References== {{reflist}} [http://www.joydawson.com www.joydawson.com] https://www.amazon.com/Joy-Dawson/e/B001IQWFP8
==External links== All Joy Dawson's books and many of her CD and DVD teachings are available from her website: [http://www.joydawson.com www.joydawson.com]. * Some of her teaching can be downloaded from the [[YWAM]] [http://ywampodcast.org podcast site]
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Dawson, Joy}} [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American Protestant missionaries]] [[Category:American religious writers]] [[Category:New Zealand Protestant missionaries]] [[Category:Missionary educators]] [[Category:Female Christian missionaries]] [[Category:New Zealand emigrants to the United States]] [[Category:20th-century New Zealand women writers]] [[Category:20th-century New Zealand writers]] [[Category:21st-century New Zealand women writers]] [[Category:21st-century New Zealand writers]] {{US-nonfiction-writer-stub}}

revision.comment: grammar
revision.text:
In [[academic publishing]], the '''lead author''', or '''first author''', is the first named [[author]] of a [[publication]] such as a [[research article]] or [[audit]].
[[Academic authorship]] standards vary widely across disciplines. In many academic subjects, including the natural sciences, computer science and electrical engineering, the lead author of a research article is typically the person who carried out the research and wrote and edited the paper. The list of trailing co-authors reflects, typically, diminishing contributions to the work reported in the manuscript. Sometimes, journals require statements detailing each author's contributions to be included in each publication.<ref>{{citation|title=Editorial: What did you do? ''Nature Physics'' now requires a statement of authors' contributions to a paper|journal=Nature Physics|volume=5|pages=369|year=2009|doi=10.1038/nphys1305}}.</ref> In other disciplines (such as mathematics) however, authors are typically listed alphabetically rather than by contribution.<ref>{{citation|url=http://www.ams.org/profession/leaders/culture/CultureStatement04.pdf|publisher=[[American Mathematical Society]]|year=2004|title=2004 Statement on The Culture of Research and Scholarship in Mathematics: Joint Research and Its Publication}}.</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cs.princeton.edu/~appel/papers/science.pdf|title=Is POPL Mathematics or Science?|author=[[Andrew Appel]]|date=January 1992}}</ref>
The proportion of multi-author papers has increased in recent decades, reflecting increasingly complex multi-investigator research projects,<ref>{{citation|last1=Weltzin|first1=J. F.|first2=R. T.|last2=Belote|first3=L. M.|last3=Thomas|first4=J. K.|last4=Keller|first5=C. E.|last5=Engel|year=2006|title=Authorship in ecology: attribution, accountability, and responsibility|journal=Frontiers in Ecology and the Environment|volume=4|pages=435–441|doi=10.1890/1540-9295(2006)4[435:AIEAAA]2.0.CO;2|jstor=3868870}}</ref> as well as the "[[publish or perish]]" culture of [[Tenure (academic)|academic performance evaluation]].
== See also == * [[Academic authorship]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
[[Category:Academic publishing]]

:''Distinguish from the [[De Morgan Medal]] awarded by the [[London Mathematical Society]].'' The '''Morgan Prize''' (actually Frank and Brennie Morgan Prize for Outstanding Research in Mathematics by an Undergraduate Student) is an annual award given to an undergraduate student in the US, Canada, or Mexico who demonstrates superior [[mathematics]] research. The $1,200 award, endowed by Mrs. Frank Morgan of [[Allentown, Pennsylvania]], was founded in 1995. The award is made jointly by the [[American Mathematical Society]], the [[Mathematical Association of America]], and the [[Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics]]. The Morgan Prize has been described as the highest honor given to an undergraduate in mathematics. <ref>https://www.chu.cam.ac.uk/news/2015/mar/17/churchill-student-receives-prestigious-morgan-priz/</ref>
==Previous winners== ;1995 :'''Winner:''' [[Kannan Soundararajan]] ([[Analytic number theory|Analytic Number Theory]], [[University of Michigan]]) :Honorable mention: [[Kiran Kedlaya]] ([[Harvard University]]) ;1996 :'''Winner:''' [[Manjul Bhargava]] ([[Algebra]], [[Harvard University]]) :Honorable mention: [[Lenhard Ng]] ([[Harvard University]]) ;1997 :'''Winner:''' [[Jade Vinson]] ([[mathematical analysis|Analysis]] and [[Geometry]], [[Washington University in St. Louis]]) :Honorable mention: [[Vikaas S. Sohal]] ([[Harvard University]]) ;1998 :'''Winner:''' [[Daniel Biss]] ([[Combinatorial group theory|Combinatorial Group Theory]] and [[Topology]], [[Harvard University]]) :Honorable mention: [[Aaron F. Archer]] ([[Harvey Mudd College]]) ;1999 :'''Winner:''' [[Sean McLaughlin (mathematician)|Sean McLaughlin]] (Proof of the [[Dodecahedral conjecture|Dodecahedral Conjecture]], [[University of Michigan]]) :Honorable mention: [[Samit Dasgupta]] ([[Harvard University]]) ;2000 :'''Winner:''' [[Jacob Lurie]] ([[Lie algebra|Lie Algebras]], [[Harvard University]]) :Honorable mention: [[Wai Ling Yee]] ([[University of Waterloo]]) ;2001 :'''Winner:''' [[Ciprian Manolescu]] ([[Floer homology|Floer Homology]], [[Harvard University]]) :Honorable mention: [[Michael Levin (mathematician)|Michael Levin]] ([[Massachusetts Institute of Technology]]) ;2002 :'''Winner:''' [[Joshua Greene (mathematician)|Joshua Greene]] (Proof of the [[Kneser graph|Kneser conjecture]], [[Harvey Mudd College]])<ref>http://www.ams.org/notices/200304/comm-morgan.pdf</ref> :Honorable mention: ''None'' ;2003 :'''Winner:''' [[Melanie Wood]] ([[Belyi-extending maps]] and [[P-orderings]], [[Duke University]])<ref>http://www.ams.org/notices/200404/comm-morgan.pdf</ref> :Honorable mention: [[Karen Yeats]] ([[University of Waterloo]]) ;2004 :'''Winner:''' [[Reid W. Barton]] ([[Packing densities|Packing Densities]] of Patterns, [[Massachusetts Institute of Technology]])<ref>http://www.ams.org/notices/200504/comm-morgan.pdf</ref> :Honorable mention: [[Po-Shen Loh]] ([[California Institute of Technology]]) ;2005 :'''Winner:''' [[Jacob Fox]] ([[Ramsey theory]] and [[graph theory]], [[Massachusetts Institute of Technology]])<ref>http://www.ams.org/notices/200604/comm-morgan.pdf</ref> :Honorable mention: ''None'' ;2007 :'''Winner:''' [[Daniel Kane (mathematician)|Daniel Kane]] ([[Number Theory]], [[Massachusetts Institute of Technology]])<ref>http://www.ams.org/notices/200704/comm-morgan-web.pdf</ref> :Honorable mention: ''None'' ;2008 :'''Winner:''' [[Nathan Kaplan (mathematician)|Nathan Kaplan]] ([[Algebraic number theory]], [[Princeton University]])<ref>http://www.ams.org/notices/200804/tx080400494p.pdf</ref> :Honorable mention: ''None'' ;2009 :'''Winner:''' [[Aaron Pixton]] ([[Algebraic topology]] and [[number theory]], [[Princeton University]])<ref>http://www.ams.org/notices/200904/rtx090400502p.pdf</ref> :Honorable mention: [[Andrei Negut]] ([[Algebraic cobordism theory]] and [[dynamical systems]], [[Princeton University]]) ;2010 :'''Winner:''' [[Scott Duke Kominers]] ([[Number theory]], [[computational geometry]], and [[mathematical economics]], [[Harvard University]])<ref>http://www.ams.org/notices/201004/rtx100400517p.pdf</ref> :Honorable mention: [[Maria Monks]] ([[Combinatorics]] and [[number theory]], [[Massachusetts Institute of Technology]]) ;2011 :'''Winner:''' [[Maria Monks]] ([[Combinatorics]] and [[number theory]], [[Massachusetts Institute of Technology]])<ref>http://www.ams.org/notices/201104/rtx110400599p.pdf</ref> :Honorable mention: [[Michael Viscardi]] ([[Algebraic geometry]], [[Harvard University]]), [[Yufei Zhao]] ([[Combinatorics]] and [[number theory]], [[Massachusetts Institute of Technology]]) ;2012 :'''Winner:''' [[John Pardon]] (Solving [[Mikhail Leonidovich Gromov|Gromov's]] problem on [[Stretch factor|distortion]] of [[Knot (mathematics)|knots]],<ref>{{cite journal |last=Pardon |first=John |year=2011 |title=On the distortion of knots on embedded surfaces |journal=[[Annals of Mathematics]] |volume=174 |issue=1 |pages=637–646 |doi=10.4007/annals.2011.174.1.21 |arxiv=1010.1972}}</ref> [[Princeton University]])<ref>[http://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2012-01/ams-ams122111.php American Mathematical Society to award prizes]</ref> :Honorable mention: [[Hannah Alpert]] ([[Combinatorics]], [[University of Chicago]]), [[Elina Robeva]] ([[Algebraic geometry]], [[Stanford University]]) ;2013 :'''Winner:''' [[Fan Wei (mathematician)|Fan Wei]] ([[Analysis]] and [[combinatorics]], [[Massachusetts Institute of Technology]])<ref>http://www.ams.org/profession/prizebooklet-2013.pdf</ref> :Honorable mention: [[Dhruv Ranganathan]] (Toric [[Gromov–Witten invariant|Gromov–Witten
